014package org.jdbi.v3.testing;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
019import java.util.function.Consumer;
020
021import javax.sql.DataSource;
022
023import com.opentable.db.postgres.embedded.EmbeddedPostgres;
024import org.flywaydb.core.Flyway;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.spi.JdbiPlugin;
028import org.junit.rules.ExternalResource;
029
030/**
031 * JUnit {@code @Rule} to manage a Jdbi instance pointed to a managed database.
032 */
033public abstract class JdbiRule extends ExternalResource {
034
035    private final List<JdbiPlugin> plugins = new ArrayList<>();
036    private final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
037    private volatile DataSource dataSource;
038    private Jdbi jdbi;
039    private Handle handle;
040    private Flyway flyway;
041    private boolean installPlugins;
042    private Migration migration;
043
044    protected abstract DataSource createDataSource();
045
046    private DataSource getDataSource() {
047        if (dataSource == null) {
048            lock.lock();
049            try {
050                if (dataSource == null) {
051                    dataSource = createDataSource();
052                }
053            } finally {
054                lock.unlock();
055            }
056        }
057        return dataSource;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Create a JdbiRule with an embedded PostgreSQL instance.
062     * Your project must depend on the {@code otj-pg-embedded} artifact.
063     */
064    public static JdbiRule embeddedPostgres() {
065        return new EmbeddedPostgresJdbiRule();
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Create a JdbiRule with an embedded PostgreSQL instance.
070     * Your project must depend on the {@code otj-pg-embedded} artifact.
071     *
072     * @param customizer {@link Consumer} to customize the created PostgreSQL instance.
073     */
074    public static JdbiRule embeddedPostgres(Consumer<EmbeddedPostgres.Builder> customizer) {
075        return new EmbeddedPostgresJdbiRule(customizer);
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Create a JdbiRule using an external PostgreSQL instance.
080     * Your project must depend on the {@code postgresql} driver artifact.
081     */
082    public static JdbiRule externalPostgres(final String hostname, final Integer port, // NOPMD
083            final String username, String password, String database) {
084        return new ExternalPostgresJdbiRule(hostname, port, username, password, database);
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Create a JdbiRule with an in-memory H2 database instance.
089     * Your project must depend on the {@code h2} database artifact.
090     */
091    public static JdbiRule h2() {
092        return new EmbeddedH2JdbiRule();
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Create a JdbiRule with an in-memory Sqlite database instance.
097     * Your project must depend on the {@code sqlite-jdbc} database artifact.
098     */
099    public static JdbiRule sqlite() {
100        return new EmbeddedSqliteJdbiRule();
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Run database migration scripts from {@code db/migration} on the classpath, using Flyway.
105     * @deprecated use {@link #withMigration(Migration)}
106     * @return this
107     */
108    @Deprecated
109    public JdbiRule migrateWithFlyway() {
110        return migrateWithFlyway("db/migration");
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Run database migration scripts from the given locations on the classpath, using Flyway.
115     * @deprecated use {@link #withMigration(Migration)}
116     * @return this
117     */
118    @Deprecated
119    @SuppressWarnings("InlineMeSuggester")
120    public JdbiRule migrateWithFlyway(String... locations) {
121        return withMigration(Migration.before().withPaths(locations));
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Run database migration.
126     */
127    public JdbiRule withMigration(final Migration newMigration) {
128        this.migration = newMigration;
129        return this;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Discover and install plugins from the classpath.
134     *
135     * @see JdbiRule#withPlugin(JdbiPlugin) we recommend installing plugins explicitly instead
136     */
137    public JdbiRule withPlugins() {
138        installPlugins = true;
139        return this;
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Install a plugin into JdbiRule.
144     */
145    public JdbiRule withPlugin(final JdbiPlugin plugin) {
146        plugins.add(plugin);
147        return this;
148    }
149
150    @Override
151    public void before() throws Throwable {
152        if (migration != null) {
153            flyway = Flyway.configure()
154                .dataSource(getDataSource())
155                .locations(migration.paths.toArray(new String[0]))
156                .schemas(migration.schemas.toArray(new String[0]))
157                .load();
158            flyway.migrate();
159        }
160
161        jdbi = Jdbi.create(getDataSource());
162        if (installPlugins) {
163            jdbi.installPlugins();
164        }
165        plugins.forEach(jdbi::installPlugin);
166        handle = jdbi.open();
167    }
168
169    @Override
170    public void after() {
171        if (flyway != null && migration.cleanAfter) {
172            flyway.clean();
173        }
174        handle.close();
175        jdbi = null;
176        dataSource = null;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Get Jdbi, in case you want to open additional handles to the same data source.
181     */
182    public Jdbi getJdbi() {
183        return jdbi;
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Get the single Handle instance opened for the duration of this test case.
188     */
189    public Handle getHandle() {
190        return handle;
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Attach an extension (such as a SqlObject) to the managed handle.
195     */
196    public <T> T attach(final Class<T> extension) {
197        return getHandle().attach(extension);
198    }
199}
